documentation: A real-valued RGB color tuple, with elements ranging from [0,1]. The Color3 data type is often used in setting the colors of objects that aren't related to bricks, such as GUIs, Sparkles, etc.

members.name: new
members.documentation: Creates a new Color3 using RGB values between 0 and 1.

arguments.name: r
arguments.documentation: The red channel of the color. This value should be between 0 and 1.

arguments.name: g
arguments.documentation: The green channel of the color. This value should be between 0 and 1.

arguments.name: b
arguments.documentation: The blue channel of the color. This value should be between 0 and 1.

members.name: fromHSV
members.documentation: Creates a new Color3 using HSV values from 0 to 1.

arguments.name: r
arguments.documentation: The red channel of the color. This value should be between 0 and 1.

arguments.name: g
arguments.documentation: The green channel of the color. This value should be between 0 and 1.

arguments.name: b
arguments.documentation: The blue channel of the color. This value should be between 0 and 1.

members.name: fromRGB
members.documentation: Creates a new Color3 using RGB integer values between 0 and 255.

arguments.name: r
arguments.documentation: The red channel of the color. This value should be between 0 and 255.

arguments.name: g
arguments.documentation: The green channel of the color. This value should be between 0 and 255.

arguments.name: b
arguments.documentation: The blue channel of the color. This value should be between 0 and 255.
